components.description: An arrow pointing diagonally in an up-right, or north-east direction.
components.title: North East Arrow

description: An arrow pointing diagonally in an up-right, or north-east direction.
title: North East Arrow

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: An arrow pointing diagonally in an up-right, or north-east direction. Up-right Arrow was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 under the n http://emojipedia.org/north-east-arrow/
emoji_net_data.name: up-right arrow

bn:13612752a: Between the cardinal directions, as for example southwest between south and west.

bn:00109848a: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north
Designating the side of the body which is positioned to the east if one is facing north. This arrow points to the right: ?

bn:00107606a: Of, related to, located in, or from the northeast.
Situated in, or pointing towards the northeast
Situated in or oriented toward the northeast
Of, related to, located in, or from the northeast
Situated in, or pointing towards the northeast.

bn:00005896n: A mark to indicate a direction or relation
A mark to indicate a direction or relation.
A sign or symbol used to indicate a direction (e.g. \to).

bn:00057102n: The compass point midway between north and east; at 45 degrees
The cardinal compass point halfway between north and east, specifically 45°, abbreviated as NE.
Northeast, a cardinal point of the compass.
Any of the four principal compass directions - north, east, south and west.
The compass point halfway between north and east, specifically 45, abbreviated as NE.
One of the four major compass points, specifically 0, directed toward the North Pole, and conventionally upwards on a map.

The four cardinal directions or cardinal points are the directions of north, east, south, and west, commonly denoted by their initials: N, E, S, W. East and west are at right angles to north and south, with east being in the clockwise direction of rotation from north and west being directly opposite east.
One of the four principal compass points, specifically 270°, conventionally directed to the left on maps. The direction of the setting sun.
Directions of north, east, south, and west
One of the four principal compass points, specifically 270, conventionally directed to the left on maps; the direction of the setting sun at an equinox.
One of the four major compass points, specifically 0°, directed toward the North Pole, and conventionally upwards on a map.
